result.execSummary:
The defendant David Vern Swenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Vern Swenson in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant David Vern Swenson in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 


The Court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 48 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  

Court objects to electronic monitoring.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and restitution in the amount of $149.06 to Pick N Save by 9/28/2020, or serve 20 days in the House of Correction.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Vern Swenson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant David Vern Swenson in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 0 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS with the following conditions:
PROBATION TO COMMENCE AT THE CONCLUSION OF CASE 15CM2607.
*NO NEW RETAIL THEFT TICKETS
*AODA/TREATMENT /RANDOM URINE SCREENS
*NO CONTACT WITH ANY PICK N SAVE STORES
*PAY RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $149.06 TO PICK N SAVE DURING TERM OF PROBATIO OR CIVIL JUDGMENT TO BE DOCKETED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT
*PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES DURING TERM OF PROBATION OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant David Vern Swenson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant David Vern Swenson in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED FOR SENTENCING.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant David Vern Swenson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify bail argued and denied by the Court. Bail: $100.00 cash to remain.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with any Pick N' Save.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant David Vern Swenson in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant David Vern Swenson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($200.00 signature bond) gj
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. lr

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Vern Swenson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. LR  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Vern Swenson in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea date scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Oral No Contact Order with any Pick N Save store.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David Vern Swenson in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/14/15 @ 1:30 pm
